Event.name: Undressing
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Wearer</fen> removes an item of <fen>Clothing</fen> from a <fen>Body_location</fen> (the part of the body that the <fen>Clothing</fen> is prototypically worn on.)
<ex>Walking on sand is better if <fex name="wea">you</fex> <t>take</t> <t>off</t> <fex name="clo">your shoes</fex>. <fex name="bod">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Wearer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual who begins the action wearing the <fen>Clothing</fen> and ends the action without it.
<ex><fex name="wea">The suspects</fex> had to <t>strip</t> publically and endure several blasts from a firehose.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Clothing
Arg.definition: <def-root>The item that the <fen>Wearer</fen> is initially wearing but then removes.</def-root>

Arg.name: Body_location
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The initial location of the <fen>Clothing</fen> on the body, before it changes location. Quite often, the location is not overtly specified and is implicitly supplied by the location on the body that the <fen>Clothing</fen> is prototypically associated with.
<ex>He <t>doffed</t> his hat <fex name="bod">from his bald head</fex>.</ex> <ex><t>Take</t> <t>off</t> your shoes and just set 'em over there. <fex name="bod">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the clothing removal which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Wearer</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>He <fex name="man">slowly and deliberately</fex> <t>took</t> <t>off</t> each shoe and placed it on the rack.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is an act whereby the <fen>Wearer</fen> achieves the removal.
<ex>With her burned hands, she could only <t>take</t> <t>off</t> her jacket <fex name="mea">by sort of vigorously shrugging</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the <fen>Wearer</fen> undresses an item of <fen>Clothing</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: doff.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: remove (an item of clothing, especially a hat).

lexUnit.name: kick off.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to take off (footwear) by moving the feet and legs.

lexUnit.name: peel off.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to remove (clothing which is snug against the body)

lexUnit.name: remove.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: take off (clothing or accoutrements on the body)

lexUnit.name: strip off.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: take off (clothing), generally rendering the wearer saliently underattired.
